#### Q36. A webpage has `rel="preconnect"` added to a link resource. What will this do?

```html
<link rel="preconnect" href="https://example.com" />
```

- [ ] It will tell the browser that this link is a site belonging to the current domain.
- [ ] It will do nothing a because this is a deprecated attribute that browsers do not support.
- [x] It will tell the browser that a connection will be made to another origin and to start getting ready as soon as possible.
- [ ] It will tell the browser that a resource is needed, and that it should start getting fetched as soon as possible.

[Source: web.dev](https://web.dev/preconnect-and-dns-prefetch/)

raw:
#### Q45. **\_** moves an element completely out of the page's normal layout flow, like it is sitting on its own separate layer. From there, you can fix it in a position relative to the edges of the page's `<html>` element (or its nearest positioned ancestor element)?

- [ ] Sticky positioning
- [x] Absolute positioning
- [ ] Relative positioning
- [ ] Fixed positioning

[Source: W3Schools](https://www.w3schools.com/css/css_positioning.asp)

**position: absolute;**
`An element with position: absolute; is positioned relative to the nearest positioned ancestor (instead of positioned relative to the viewport, like fixed). However; if an absolute positioned element has no positioned ancestors, it uses the document body, and moves along with page scrolling.`

question.html: Q45. _ moves an element completely out of the page's normal layout flow, like it is sitting on its own separate layer. From there, you can fix it in a position relative to the edges of the page's <html> element (or its nearest positioned ancestor element)?

- [x] The CSS is being loaded asynchronously in order to prevent render blocking.
- [ ] This will stop the CSS being loaded for old browsers that do not support the techniques in use.
- [ ] This is part of a stylesheet-switching script to load different themes for the site.
- [ ] This will stop the CCS being loaded on slow data connections.

question.html: Q64. Which code example would center .box inside .container?

preformated.html:
<div class="container">
  <div class="box">what a lovely box, very centered</div>
</div>
preformated.text: what a lovely box, very centered

variants.html:
A
.container {
  display: flex;
  align-items: center;
}

B
.container {
  display: flex;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
}

C
.box {
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
}

D
.container {
  display: flex;
  align: center;
}

- [ ] :focus-ring

[Reference](https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/focus-rings-for-keyboard-interactions-only/)

question.html: Q83.Which pseudo-class allows you to selectively show a focus ring on elements only if keyboard navigation is detected?
question.text: Q83.Which pseudo-class allows you to selectively show a focus ring on elements only if keyboard navigation is detected?

raw:
#### Q84. To create a collection of radio buttons associated with the same field, each <input> tag must \_\_\_\_.

- [ ] have the same value of the id attribute
- [x] have the same value of the name attribute
- [ ] belong to the same field set
- [ ] have the same value of the class attribute

question.html: Q84. To create a collection of radio buttons associated with the same field, each <input> tag must ____.
question.text: Q84. To create a collection of radio buttons associated with the same field, each <input> tag must ____.

variants.html: have the same value of the id attribute
variants.text: have the same value of the id attribute

variants.html: have the same value of the name attribute
variants.text: have the same value of the name attribute

variants.html: belong to the same field set
variants.text: belong to the same field set

variants.html: have the same value of the class attribute
variants.text: have the same value of the class attribute
